righthandWords.words: Some of the children were badly-behaved.|We took all the children to Disneyland.|I didn't take all the books to the charity shop.|I took all the books to the charity shop.|There was only one bank in the town.|There were several banks in the town.|I have more than one camera.|I only have one camera.

lefthandWords.words: We took the children who were well-behaved to Disneyland.|We took the children, who were well-behaved, to Disneyland.|I took the books I didn't like to the charity shop.|I took the books, which I didn't like, to the charity shop.|We cashed our cheques at the bank, which was on Main Street.|We cashed our cheques at the bank which was on Main Street.|The camera I bought on the Internet didn't work well.|The camera, which I bought on the Internet, didn't work well.
